summary: "Robinson Crusoe" is an adventure book by Daniel Defoe, published in 1719. It tells the story of Crusoe, who spends 28 years on a deserted island after a shipwreck. He meets cannibals and rescues a man named Friday. The book is based on real-life castaways like Alexander Selkirk. Though written simply, it was well-liked and is seen as the start of realistic fiction. It's one of the most published books ever, inspiring many other stories and even a genre called the Robinsonade.
title: Robinson Crusoe
